data.title: Crosby, Stills & Nash - Carry On (CD) (VG+, VG+)
data.meta_description: Crosby, Stills & Nash : Carry On (Compilation,Reissue,Remastered) is available for sale at Nail City Record. We have a huge collection of Vinyl's, CD's, Cassettes & other formats available for sale for music lovers
data.text:
Crosby, Stills & Nash - Carry On

Compilation,Reissue,Remastered

Media Condition: Very Good Plus (VG+)

Sleeve Condition: Very Good Plus (VG+)

Condition Details: CD is in VG+ condition. Plays without issue. Includes insert booklet.

RELEASE DATE:

DESCRIPTION

This compilation ℗ © 1991 Atlantic Recording Corporation for the United States and WEA International Inc. for the world outside of the United States. (printed on disc media, at the bottom of the rear inlay and at the bottom of page 18) Manufactured and distributed by Warner Music Australia (logo) A Warner Music Group Company. (printed at the bottom of the rear inlay and around the edge of the disc media) Packaging: 20-page booklet. Track 1-1: Recorded at Wally Heider's Studio C, San Francisco, November 5, 1969. Mixed November 5, 1969. Song originally released on Déjà Vu, March 11, 1970. Unreleased alternate mix Track 1-2: Recorded at Wally Heider's Studio III, Los Angeles, early 1969. Originally released on Crosby, Stills & Nash, May 29, 1969 Track 1-3: Recorded at The Record Plant, New York City, December 1968. Song originally released on Crosby, Stills & Nash, May 29, 1969. Unreleased first Crosby Stills & Nash recording Track 1-4: Recorded at Wally Heider's Studio C, San Francisco, October 24, 1969. Originally released on Déjà Vu, March 11, 1970 Track 1-5: Recorded at Island Studios, London, England. Originally released on Stephen Stills, November 16, 1970 Track 1-6: Recorded at Wally Heider's Studio C, San Francisco, January 9, 1970. Song originally released on Déjà Vu, March 11, 1970. Unreleased unedited original version Track 1-7: Recorded at Wally Heider's Studio III, Los Angeles, February 20, 1969. Originally released on Crosby, Stills & Nash, May 29, 1969 Track 1-8: Recorded live in Portland, Oregon, December 5, 1982. Song originally released on CSN , June 17, 1977. This version originally released on Allies, June 6, 1983 Track 1-9: Recorded at Wally Heider's Studio C, San Francisco, November 7, 1969. Originally released on Déjà Vu, March 11, 1970 Track 1-10: Recorded at Wally Heider's Studio C, San Francisco, February 28, 1971. Originally released on Songs For Beginners, May 28, 1971 Track 1-11: Recorded at Criteria Sound Studios, Miami, January 22, 1977. Originally released on CSN, June 17, 1977 Track 1-12: Recorded at Wally Heider's Studio III, Los Angeles, July 16, 1969. Mixed by Stephen Bancard, July 1, 1991. Song originally released on Déjà Vu, March 11, 1970. Unreleased alternate mix Track 1-13: Recorded at Wally Heider's Studio III, Los Angeles, November 5, 1969. Originally released on Déjà Vu, March 11, 1970 Track 1-14: (a) 'Critical Mass': Recorded at His Master's Wheels and Rudy Records, San Francisco, May 11, 1975. Originally released on Wind On The Water, September 15, 1975. (b) 'Wind On The Water': Recorded at Village Recorders, Los Angeles, July 1, 1975. Originally released on Wind On The Water, September 15, 1975 Track 1-15: Recorded at Island Studios, London, England. Originally released on Stephen Stills 2, June 30, 1971 Track 1-16: Recorded at Criteria Sound Studios, Miami, December 19, 1976. Originally released on CSN, June 17, 1977 Track 1-17: Recorded at Record Plant Studio 3, Los Angeles, May 21, 1970. Originally released as a CSN&Y single, June 4, 1970 Track 1-18: Recorded at Rudy Records, Los Angeles, November 30, 1980-January 30, 1981. Originally released on Daylight Again, June 21, 1982 Track 1-19: Recorded at Rudy Records, Los Angeles, 1981. Originally released on Daylight Again, June 21, 1982 Track 2-1: Recorded at Wally Heider's Studio III, Los Angeles, early 1969. Song originally on Crosby, Stills & Nash, May 29, 1969. Unreleased alternate mix. Original 7.5 ips tape courtesy of the Joel Bernstein Collection. Track 2-2: Recorded at Wally Heider's Studio C, San Francisco, December 28, 1969. originally released on Déjà Vu, March 11, 1970. Track 2-3: Recorded at Stephen's house, Laurel Canyon, Los Angeles; and at Wally Heider's Studio III, Los Angeles, December 28, 1969. Mixed on June 17, 1991. Unreleased song Track 2-4: Recorded at Criteria Sound Studios, Miami, January 8, 1972. Originally released on Manassas, April 12, 1972 Track 2-5: Recorded at United Studio B, Hollywood, June 26, 1968. Mixed on June 30, 1991. Song originally released on Crosby, Stills & Nash, May 29, 1969. Unreleased early demo Track 2-6: Recorded at Sunwest Studios, Los Angeles, June 15, 1969. Mixed on June 19, 1991. Song originally released on Crosby, Stills & Nash, May 29, 1969. Unreleased live studio version Track 2-7: Recorded at Stephen's house, Laurel Canyon, Los Angeles, December 28, 1969. Mixed on August 2, 1991. Song originally released on Four Way Street, April 7, 1971. Unreleased version. Track 2-8: Recorded at Criteria Sound Studios, Miami, April 1, 1976. Mixed on June 19, 1991. Song originally released on Crosby & Nash's Whistling Down The Wire, 1976. Unreleased CSN&Y version Track 2-9: Recorded at Criteria Sound Studios, Miami, January 14, 1977. Originally released on CSN, June 17, 1977 Track 2-10: Recorded at Rudy Records, Los Angeles, January 1981. Mixed on June 30, 1991. Song originally released on Stills, June 1975. Unreleased version Track 2-11: Recorded at The Sound Labs, Los Angeles, 1978. Song originally released on Oh Yes I Can, January 23, 1989. Unreleased version Track 2-12: Recorded at Rudy Records, Los Angeles, November 17, 1980. Composition first released on Traffic's Mr Fantasy, January 1968. Unreleased version Track 2-13: Recorded at Criteria Sound Studios, Miami, January 12, 1977. Originally released on CSN, June 17, 1977 Track 2-14: Recorded at The Record Plant, Studio I, Los Angeles, February 2, 1990. Released on Live It Up, June 11, 1990 Track 2-15: Recorded at The Record Plant, Studio I, Los Angeles, April 3, 1990. Released on Live It Up, June 11, 1990 Track 2-16: Recorded at Devonshire Studio 3, Los Angeles, February 1, 1989. Released on Live It Up, June 11, 1990 Track 2-17: Recorded at The Record Plant, Los Angeles, May 21, 1970. Originally released as the b-side of the "Ohio" single, June 4, 1970 Track 1: Siquomb Publishing; Tracks 1-2, 1-4, 1-10, 1-11, 1-13, 1-14b, 1-16 & 1-18: Nash Notes; Tracks 1-3, 1-5, 1-8, 1-12, 1-15, 2-1. 2-2, 2-4, 2-6, 2-10 & 2-17: Gold Hill Music, Inc.; Tracks 1-6, 1-14a, 2-5, 2-7 & 2-11: Stay Straight Music; Track 1-7: Gold Hill Music, Inc./Stay Straight Music, Inc./Icebag Music Corp.; Tracks 1-9 & 1-17: Cotillion Music Inc./Broken Arrow Music, adm. by Warner-Tamerlane Publishing Corp.; Track 1-19: Gold Hill Music/Kenwon Music; Track 2-3: Nash Notes/Catlin Music Ltd./Enquiry Music Ltd.; Track 2-8: Nash Notes/Stay Straight Music; Track 2-9: Stay Straight Music/Fair Star Music, Inc.; Track 2-12: Songs of Polygram International, Inc.; Track 2-13: Guerilla Music; Track 2-14: Nash Notes/Stay Straight Music/Fair Star Music, Inc.; Track 2-15: Gold Hill Music, Inc./Dudes Tunes; Track 2-16: Nash Notes/Fair Star Music, Inc.

TRACKLIST

1-1. Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young - Woodstock (1969 Unreleased Alternate Mix) 3:50

1-2. Crosby, Stills & Nash - Marrakesh Express 2:36

1-3. Crosby, Stills & Nash - You Don't Have To Cry (Unreleased Version) 2:40

1-8. Crosby, Stills & Nash - Dark Star (Live Version) 4:57

. David Crosby, Graham Nash - To The Last Whale... 5:30

1-15. Stephen Stills - Change Partners 3:13

1-17. Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young - Ohio 3:00

1-18. Crosby, Stills & Nash - Wasted On The Way 2:46

1-19. Crosby, Stills & Nash - Southern Cross 4:39

2-3. Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young - Horses Through A Rainstorm (Unreleased Song) 3:40

2-4. Manassas - Johnny's Garden 2:46

2-5. David Crosby - Guinnevere (Unreleased Early Demo) 4:45

2-6. Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young - Helplessly Hoping (Unreleased Live Studio Version) 2:31

2-7. Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young - The Lee Shore (Unreleased Version) 5:28

2-8. Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young - Taken At All (Unreleased CSN&Y Version) 2:54

2-9. Crosby, Stills & Nash - Shadow Captain 4:31

2-10. Crosby, Stills & Nash - As I Come Of Age (Unreleased Version) 2:48

2-11. David Crosby - Drive My Car (Unreleased Version) 3:50

2-12. Stephen Stills, Graham Nash - Dear Mr. Fantasy (Unreleased Version) 7:04

2-13. Crosby, Stills & Nash - In My Dreams 5:11

2-14. Crosby, Stills & Nash - Yours And Mine 4:28

2-15. Crosby, Stills & Nash - Haven't We Lost Enough? 3:06

2-16. Crosby, Stills & Nash - After The Dolphin 4:55

2-17. Crosby, Stills, Nash & Young - Find The Cost Of Freedom 1:59
